name: The Ice House Hotel

reviews.title: great location but needs some love and attention
reviews.text: For a hotel that is only a few years old this hotel is really showing its age, our room had damp everywhere, wall chipped etc. All throughout the hotel it was the same which was a pity. Also no porters, a guy in a suit had to help us but as we had 4 cases it was a struggle, they should invest in a property luggage trolley.
Highlights the position is wonderful on the river, and the breakfast had to be the best we had throughout out 8 day stay in ireland.
reviews.title: The best hotel in ballin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it was the most expensive hotel we stayed in and in hindsight we would have stayed another night in the g in galway instead of coming to this place.
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For sure the best hotel in ballina. 5 star. Great food, great service and attention to detail, and stunning location, have sent many from work there and they agree. I like the menu as its fresh and concise. Portions are small to some irish standards, but I would say they are spot on for high end top class restaurant.
reviews.title: Definitely worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived in the Ice House we were made feel at home. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready so we went downstairs to the bar for a drink. When we came back up, our bags were brought to our room for us.
reviews.title: Beautiful View on the Water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner brought me away for the weekend to The Ice House to celebrate my 30th Birthday, from start to finish our stay was fabulous. When we arrived we were greeted warmly and given a complimentary glass of 'bubbles' while our bags were brought to the room. In the room we found a plate of chocolate strawberries with 'Happy Birthday' written on the plate in chocolate, and a hand written note from the management welcoming us to the hotel. The view from the room was gorgeous and the bed was so comfy. We availed of the complimentary breakfast in bed on the Sunday morning, which was tasty. I can honestly say that this was one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in, not just the fact that it is fabulously decorated, but that all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. It is fairly expensive, but it definitely lives up to it unlike a lot of other hotels around Ireland. I would highly recommend staying here, and can't wait til I can go back myself!
reviews.title: Best hotel stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and i arrived at the ice house after quite a long journey from downpatrick, the weather combined with the driving conditions was rather awesome , however , from the moment we arrived nothing else mattered, the staff, ambience along with the upgrade to a suite made the occasion even better, i would love to go back again when the weather is better and go on the all day fishing trip, the food was beautiful,the spa was quiet class which we indulged in, perhaps sometime soon if in ireland we have a heatwave we would be back tomorrow, also the eggs benedict were everything i had dreamed of xo.
reviews.title: regardless of the weather the ice house was just great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived on 21st may as part of my 50th birthday celebrations.check in was the most stress free experience.we were met by competent and friendly staff who helped us relax by offering us a glass of bubbly.a great way to start our stay.our room was beautiful and as for the bed,well it was the most comfortable ive slept in.dinner that evening was fantastic but perhaps a little slow.our waitress who i think was called timia was professional and friendly.next morning we indulged in eggs benedict.yum yum.over all a great experience and all i can say is ice house you are red hot
reviews.title: its a must

reviews.text: I booked the Ice House at the last minute at got a very good B&B rate. Upon arrival I was greeted warmly, my bag taken and given Coffee as I was early for check-in. I was given a deluxe room next to the river which was excellent. Complimentary use of out-door spa pools and steam rooms was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay....

reviews.text: Lunch was nice, had the chowder however dinner was less so. Had the chicken curry which was very bland and chewy - dinner service wasn't great either.
reviews.title: out of this world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed one night recently in the Bartra Suite. From the moment we stepped into the Ice House we enjoyed an amazing stay. The service was perfect and all staff from the receptionist, bar staff and waiters were friendly but professional. We enjoyed a glass of bubbly on arrival as our bags were taken to our suite by the porter. As it was a sunny day we were then able to enjoy drinks on the terrace, the views are amazing and you really could be anywhere in the world. When we eventually got to our room we were completely blown away by the attention to detail and little luxuries. The Bartra suite has amazing views from numerous picture windows in the bedroom and separate sitting room. It is in the original building and retains its old world charm with antique furniture yet has all the modern facilities you would expect from such a top class hotel, the bathroom with its free standing wooden bath and luxury shower is filled with fabulous L'occitane products. We dressed for dinner and made our way to the bar where we enjoyed some wine while waiting for our table. The restaurant was fully booked yet the staff were efficient and friendly. The food was top class, I had heard that the portions are small but we did not find this. The homemade breads and sides with the mains meant that we were comfortably full after enjoying our four courses and still had room to enjoy some cocktails in the bar! The bed was total bliss and we enjoyed a delicious breakfast delivered to our room the next morning while lounging in the fluffy bathrobes that are provided. Overall it was 24 hours of pure heaven. Well done to all the staff. I am looking forward to my next stay at the Ice House!
reviews.title: Complete Luxury...A magical place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second visit to the Ice House and sometimes its not the same when you go back a second time, but I needn't have worried. This time I choose one of the heritage suites and its from a world gone by. A very large suite with 5 windows, all old furniture.
reviews.title: The Moy Suite was all I hoped it would be

reviews.text: A very comfortable bed and a huge wooden tub in bathroom. Hotel rooms can become very boring so this was a lovely change. If you were looking for a romantic hotel room this is it. Most of this passed over my fella,s head as the golf was on the tv but a girl can dream.
reviews.title: Overpriced restaurant with poor service

reviews.text: We went expecting a truly wonderfull evening after enjoying The Ballina Salmon Festival.All of our party of six found the service lacking to say the least, we waited fifteen mins. at the table before anyone took our drinks order and a further fifteen mins.before they arrived. The portions are tiny and would not even fill my four year old grandson.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, friendly staff and great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We complained to the waiteress and the manager of the restaurant at the table about the small portions , only to be told he would pass our comments on to the chef.
reviews.title: A little piece of luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent a weekend at the Ice House Hotel and were slightly disappointed with our stay.
reviews.title: A Very Mediocre Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start, the hotel is situated on the River Moy which is a lovely setting. It’s a small hotel with 32 rooms which gives it a more intimate feel. Originally, it was an actual ice store (hence the name!) and the hotel itself still maintains the original features of the old house which surprisingly, mixes very well with the modern element of the hotel. It’s well sign-posted and easy to find. First impressions were good!
reviews.title: Great place for a few relaxing days (but still room for improvement)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked into the hotel at 10 past 3 however our room wasn’t ready. We were offered tea/coffee or a glass of champagne while we waited for our room. We had booked into the spa for a 30 minute “mini” treatment at 3.30. As our room wasn’t ready we were unable to change in our room, the girl on reception told us to relax, take our time and enjoy our refreshments as she would phone the spa and explain that we were going to be delayed. On arrival to the spa at 3.40 after changing in our room, the girl told us that as we were late that they would finish our treatments as originally planned! Had we known our treatments were to be cut short we would have changed down in the spa. After explaining what had happened and a quick call to reception, the girl agreed to allow us our 30 minute treatment. It wasn’t a major issue but not the perfect way to start the weekend. The spa is lovely and definitely worth a visit if staying in the hotel.
reviews.title: We are all interested in a good story

reviews.text: Reception was casually friendly which was fine but we were given very little by way of detail. We weren’t told where the bar, restaurant etc were situated so we found ourselves having to go back on a few occasions asking how to get to these parts of hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect- a real hidden gem 

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are ok only, they are modern but ours was slightly tatty. Our room overlooked the River Moy which was a lovely view. The beds are extremely comfortable unfortunately the walls are so thin that it’s difficult to enjoy a good sleep in these beds as you’re woken by talking, tv and general noise from the rooms next door. Our friends who were staying a few rooms down the corridor from us also found it noisy. We availed of having our breakfast in bed which was very nice. The breakfast was roasting hot when it arrived; even the toast was still very warm. We ordered our breakfast to arrive at 10 a.m. and it arrived on the dot of 10 a.m. It’s definitely the way to go!
reviews.title: A little bit of luxury

description: "A surprising retreat perched on the edge of the River Moy' in Ballina, County Mayo, The Ice House Hotel & Spa is the perfect retreat which combines a traditional experience with a contemporary style. Originally built in 1859 as an ice store, The Ice House is a chic boutique hotel with a stunning fusion of old and new and beautiful panoramic river views. The award winning restaurant at The Ice House serves delicious modern seasonal cuisine whilst the Chill Spa provides soothing Yon-ka and Voya body treatments and includes a spa thermal suite and an outdoor spa garden featuring hot tubs, seaweed baths and a cedar barrel sauna. Simply heaven! The Ice House Hotel's 28 bedrooms and 7 suites are located in both the carefully restored original House and the architecturally dazzling contemporary wings, and all the rooms are individually designed and equipped with the very latest technology. Bathrooms boast toe warming under floor heating, extra soft towels and premium bathroom products by L'Occitane en Provence. Light filled spacious rooms, super-king pillow top beds with goose down duvets, bespoke furniture and the latest flat screen entertainment centers are featured throughout. The Ice House Hotel & Spa is the perfect place to chill.
